conversations_v0.question: As shown in the diagram, the angle of corner B in a curved pipe ABCD is 75°. If pipe AB is parallel to CD, the angle of corner C is ()
conversations_v0.answer: When examining the diagram, the key observation is that the segments AB and CD are parallel. In geometry, when dealing with parallel lines and a transversal, the consecutive interior angles add up to 180°. Given that the angle at corner B is specified as 75°, we know that the angle at corner C must be 180° - 75° = 105° to satisfy this rule. Thus, the angle at corner C is 105°. Hence, the answer is A: 105°.
